intro: Zornia hebecarpa, commonly known as the rough zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, followed by elongated, bean-like pods. Zornia hebecarpa is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
